definitions.definition: To place or arrange in(to) a desired (especially: calm) state, or make final disposition of (something).
To become calm, quiet, or orderly; to stop being agitated.
definitions.example: the weather settled;  wait until the crowd settles before speaking

definitions.definition: To establish or become established in a steady position:
To fix one's residence in a place; to establish a dwelling place, home, or colony. (Compare settle down.)
definitions.example: the Saxons who settled in Britain

definitions.definition: To move (people) to (a land or territory), so as to colonize it; to cause (people) to take residence in (a place).
To sink, or cause (something, or impurities within it) to sink down, especially so as to become clear or compact.
To make a jointure for a spouse.
(of an animal) To make or become pregnant.
Comfortable and at ease, especially after a period of change or unrest.
definitions.example: It took me a while to feel settled after I moved to this big city.
